name: Themes in Canadian Environmental History
description: Environmental historians study the reciprocal relationship between humans and nature over time. This course examines key themes in the history of Canada's environment. Possible topics include food, energy, pollution, cities, parks, and environmental movements. Specific themes vary by year, depending on the focus of the instructor. Strong emphasis is place on reading and research.
prerequisites: A 2nd year Canadian history course or permission of the instructor.
